greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Tree generated by the lucky numbers: a(1) = 1; a(2n) = unlucky(a(n)), a(2n+1) = lucky(a(n+1)), where lucky = A000959, unlucky = A050505.
comment: A permutation of the positive integers. See the comment at A183079.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..512
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: Let L(n) = A000959(n), the n-th lucky number.
Let U(n) = A050505(n), the n-th unlucky numbers.
The tree-array T(n,k) is then given by rows:
example: Top 6 levels of the binary tree:
From the level 3 to the level 4: 3 --> (7,5) and 4 --> (9,6).
xref: Cf. A257726 (similar permutation with a slightly different definition, resulting the first differing term at n=9, where a(9) = 21, while A257726(9) = 13), A257735 - A257738.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Dec 24 2010
ext: Added a formula to the Name field and more terms, edited Example section - _Antti Karttunen_, May 09 2015
